website_summaries.verdict: A good medium-priced option to choose if you have a limited budget but still want more volume and dynamic output.
pros: Durable construction and great sound, thanks in part to the molded plastic outer exterior
Maximum 600-watt power rating is just enough to fill a typical car interior with better low ends
cons: Subwoofer speaker requires special or professional installation

customer_reviews.title: 2002-2009 4Runner w/JBL Subwoofer direct, no mod replacement.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace the failed factory subwoofer on my 4th Gen 4runner (2004) w/JBL system. It fit PERFECTLY and sounds BETTER than the factory one did when it worked. If you are looking at this speaker because you have the same problem, that being a 2002-2009 4runner (JBL Sound System) with a bad (rattling) rear sub and have found that the factory enclosure is too shallow to accommodate most off the shelf subs, then buy THIS speaker. This is the right one, and it fits without any modification.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Fit the 05 Toyota 4runner
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pioneer to replace the stock jbl sub it finally blew, it's a direct fit as the factory JBL that comes in the 05 4runner fit perfect sounds better now, wasnt hard to Install either, highly recommend it, if you have a 4 runner that the factor JBL needs replacing this pioneer 8" is the way to go,hopefully it will last if not I will update.
customer_reviews.author: GSXRKING

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Speaker (4Runner Upgrade)
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT for 2003 Toyota 4Runner! Easy install. Red Wire is Positive and Yellow is Negative (bottom plug) Black wire is Positive and Green wire is Negative (top plug) Yes, you need to cut off OEM plugs and strip the wires (easy DIY youtube videos helped me)
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: 2017 Ram 1500 crew cab sub upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Sounds so much better than the stock sub in my ram 1500 crew cab. Direct replacement, no amp upgrade needed
customer_reviews.author: keepitight

customer_reviews.title: I installed this in my 2015 Ram 2500 Limited. ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in my 2015 Ram 2500 Limited. It fit the factory sub box perfectly. No new holes nor cutting was required. It sounds a lot cleaner and louder than the factory sub. I am using the stock wiring harness (no splicing) and factory screws. I used the Metra 72-6514 Speaker Harness. Use the the foam tape to seal the sub and plug the factory hole in the back of sub box that was sued to attached factory sub.
customer_reviews.author: M. Goo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement In a Jeep Wrangler with the Infinity or Alpine systems.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: sound amazing and stand pretty well a loud volume (2008 Toyota ...
customer_reviews.text: do not underestimate this 8" lol .... if you're looking for power and deep bass this is not your choice if it is an enclosure, try a vented box, however, sound amazing and stand pretty well a loud volume (2008 Toyota 4 runner.. JBL sound system Synthesis, just plug it ) the JBL amp can handle it easily
customer_reviews.author: Maria A. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Upgrade from OEM in Newer Ram Trucks
customer_reviews.text: A perfect upgrade to the OEM subwoofer in newer RAM pickup trucks. I swapped out the factory speaker with this in my 2015 Laramie edition, it is a vast improvement in the crispness of the bass at a very reasonable price. Paired up with the Metra 72-6514 wiring adapter installation took less than an hour from start to finish.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Marginally better compared to Ram Alpine 8
customer_reviews.text: This sub is decent at best. It replaced a factory 8 inch sub in my Ram Quad Cab. I purchased this because of the reviews on sound quality while being compared to the factory Alpine 8 inch sub. What I can honestly tell you, the sound quality is minimally better. It's not worth the price and installation "better". I wouldn't change the factory sub if I had to do it all over again.
customer_reviews.author: brad danos

customer_reviews.title: 8" sub woofer + stock install = excellent sounds
customer_reviews.text: Installed the 8" version to replace a broken sub woofer for a Toyota Sienna. It was a direct bolt in replacement and fit very well. When I first looked at the speaker, the suspension seemed very stiff and I thought the output would be limited without a larger amplifier, but after installing it, the bass was much better than stock. Both crisper and deeper. Don't know how it does what it does, but was worth every penny. The speaker includes foam sealing tape and screws for installation. Highly recommend this speaker!
customer_reviews.author: kf

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this speaker as a replacement for the factory sub in a 2007 Toyota 4Runner. The JBL subs are known to blowout and after mine did I needed something quick. This speaker has proven to be a good fit and a better sound than the factory speaker at a great price. It was a job getting it installed but I'm glad I've made the change, the music sounds so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Southernguy

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 2007 4Runner
customer_reviews.text: My 2007 4Runner had a blown woofer. This fit like a charm for the existing JBL sound system. The most difficult part of changing the woofer out is to make sure you keep the (+) and (-) wires the same. Great to have bass again!
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: 2018 RAM 3500 Alpine 10 Speker System
customer_reviews.text: I bought this subwoofer as a drop in replacement for the stock subwoofer that came with my vehicle. Well worth the money. If I was building a premium stereo system I’d have much more to do and this is hardly that type of update. However, if you want to replace the low quality craftsmanship stock sub and get crisper base and better quality built speaker this works well and is reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Great sub for my '97 Ford Expedition!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant about buying a returned subwoofer in good condition from Amazon but other then a back screw being a little loose, which tightened down no problem, it sounded KILLER after installing it in my '97 Ford Expedition. I needed a shallow depth sub to fit in the factory Mach audio sub box and this guy worked perfectly. No new drilling for the screw holes, it aligned perfectly with the factory holes. If anyone is looking for a sub for their '98-'02 Expedition I would recommend this sub.
customer_reviews.author: The James Family of ABQ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for the blown factory subwoofer on my 2006 Toyota 4Runner
customer_reviews.text: The biggest aspect I was concerned about was would this subwoofer match the blown factory subwoofer - both size-wise (and electrical connectivity-wise). I had this subwoofer put in for me by Car Toys. Their tech took less than 30 minutes to put it in and he said it was a breeze. It sounds great too! The only issue we had was that the seller shipped us the Pioneer TS-A2000LD2 instead of what we ordered Pioneer TS-SW2002D2. We called Pioneer tech services and they said it was the european version of what we ordered and that it was equivalent (slightly higher peak power)...it was fine. It all worked out!
customer_reviews.author: StevenC

customer_reviews.title: Certain bass notes it distortes
customer_reviews.text: Install in Ram factory alpine system was simple , not sure if i installed correctly as certain bass beats , even at very low volume distort , funny though its only a certain bass tone it distorts no matter volume level , most music its excellent upgrade , gotta look further into whether I hooked wires wrong maybe? So not really sure as all positive & negatives are correct ,,
customer_reviews.author: Jblack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for 2014 Ram 1500
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for stock 2014 ram 1500 sub. Start to finish took less than an hour. Make sure you plug the hole in the bottom where the screw was that held the stick speaker. Don’t know about overall sound quality will update later
customer_reviews.author: Cary Stickles

customer_reviews.title: Needs the right setup, but good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Let's be real 8 inches is tiny in the sub world. The idea here is low end reinforcement and quality. Even the smallest SW2002 is a proper dual voice coil sub that wants power and a proper enclosure. It's not a stock replacement for your Japanese truck door panel accounting for the other negative reviews. C'mon guys. Used with an amp as designed, maybe some accurate 6.5 mains, and magic happens.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Speaker is great, installing into a 2008 toyota 4runner not so much
customer_reviews.text: First everything about the speaker itself is fine. However if you have a similar model to my car be prepared for some tedious replacement. First you have to take apart half the paneling in the back of your car just to reach your subwoofer, then installing is very tricky since the stock cover won't screw in over the subwoofer, I wound up salvaging the original cover and just using that but it was not an easy fit. After everything was said and done it works great, no distortion, about as good if not better than my old one but its hard to tell since my old one has been blown out for so long.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Vickers

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the the factory sony 8" sub in my 2015 f350 as I felt it could use some improvement. It sounds very nice and noticeably punchier deeper bass. If you want something to rattle your bones I suggest getting aftermarket subs, enclosure, and amp. If you want to slightly up your bass game, slap this sub in there. The only thing I had to do was plug the screwhole in the back of the factory enclosure and drill new holes to fasten the sub in.
customer_reviews.author: workingclassless84

customer_reviews.title: Installed this in my 2013 Audi A7 in the original ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in my 2013 Audi A7 in the original OEM plastic Bose box. While I had to heat and reform a small part of the box to get it to fit, it was minimal effort. You could barely hear the stock Bose sub and I was leery that this small sub would make a difference but it was worth a shot for the price. From a person who has had serious custom systems in cars over the years, I am overly impressed with the punch this little 8" has. I hooked up a Rockford 500x1 amp and at barely half volume, it rattles the back half of the car.
customer_reviews.author: design one

customer_reviews.title: Good sub
customer_reviews.text: I used this speaker to replace the factor 7-5/8" sub that was in my 02 tahoe. I did have to trim about a 1/4 inch off of the entire speaker diameter in order for it to fit, but that wasn't a problem at all. I used a straight cut tin snip and about 5 min and job was done.
customer_reviews.author: david helms

customer_reviews.title: Absolute perfect and easy replacement for the stock JBL in our ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolute perfect and easy replacement for the stock JBL in our 2006 4runner. Very easy to remove old and install new. Did NOT have to take up the floor carpet and panel, just the side panel and speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Triton

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not as much bass as expected
customer_reviews.text: Installs well and Works well in my jeep wrangler jku 2013. Direct replacement to stock sub woofer. However i expected more bass power from the subwoofer. Slightly disappointed not much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice upgrade for Jeep Wrangler subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice upgrade for Jeep Wrangler subwoofer. Sound quality is tight and very responsive. The only complaints I would have would be related to the Jeep system; but for someone wanting a cheap upgrade to clear up the factory sound, this subwoofer paired with the Infinity Reference 6032i is night and day difference.
customer_reviews.author: charles hunt

customer_reviews.title: Give it some time to break in...
customer_reviews.text: I used this driver to replace the OE unit in my 2017 Ford SD. Initially, I wasn't pleased but after a few weeks of break in, this little sub really performs. When first installed, I wasn't sure it was much of an improvement but after the break in, wow. I'm driving it with a JL 250w RMS mono sub amp and use a remote volume knob to control the level. Very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: taken

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 8 inch shallow mount subwoofer a couple months ago, and it is still working amazing. At first I was skeptical about even getting this because of the size being so small. Don’t get me wrong, they won’t shake the neighborhood by any means, but they give you just enough bass to make the whole sound of a song change. They hit harder than I thought given the size, and I would definitely buy this again if it ever quits working.
customer_reviews.author: Braden E.

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after days of research for my 2013 Hyundai Sonata 2.0T after the warranty no longer covered the sound system. I was able to install it myself but it wasn't all too easy. Fits well into the designated space, just had to add some speaker wires to the existing cables as an extension. Other than that, has a very nice low-end, and fits just fine. I am definitely satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio.

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great as a replacement for the stock sub in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great as a replacement for the stock sub in my 2001 Yukon XL (Suburban). While not a direct fit it does clear the stock plastic panel when surface mounted over the original hole.
customer_reviews.author: Mutt

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to finally get my bass back in my jk wrangler and this speaker either came blown already or blew right away I'm not sure but it does nothing but vibrate the entire time.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for 2003-2009 4runners
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect in my 2006 4runner limited with JBL. Didn’t even have to drill any new holes. Highly recommend putting poly fill in your enclosure. I tried without any first, then filled it and it hits much deeper now.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Its ok, has low rms
customer_reviews.text: this speaker is just OK. its made an ok amount of bass as the stock replacement in on moms 00 Tahoe. it didn't fit in the stock box the basket was to big so we had to go with a small sealed box about. i had ordered a planet audio 600 watt amp to go with it but the speaker it self runs at 150 watts so i only used one channel and didn't bridge it as i had wanted to. i didn't like the fact that it rms is a quarter of the max power. it seems like it would do much better in a small car.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Stock sub sounds better...
customer_reviews.text: Just put it into a MDX rear sub replacement. It sounds likes it’s blown and rattles. Stock sub sounded much better. Will return and upgrade to Kicker. I think the fact that it is 20-200 is the issue. Kicker is 30-500 so I think this sub picks up way too much low freq making it unstable.
customer_reviews.author: DGC

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for my 2003 4Runner JBL 8” Sub
customer_reviews.text: My stock 8” sub blew. So I purchased these and it sounds night and day. I don’t know how the stock one sounds so I can’t compare. It was a little work due to where the sub is located on the 4Runner.
customer_reviews.author: thone nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2007 - 2009 Toyota Tundra JBL subs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My OEM sub blew in my Truck. For $60 this was a great and easy replacement. Strip green wire and black wire. Cut a section of the original green/black and wire positive to negative on the 3 and 4th coils, attach green to red terminal and black to negative. Sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: The Minters

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for '03 4runner subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my blown factory subwoofer in my '03 Toyota 4runner. Other owners said they have used this so I decided to also. Mounting holes don't line up so some drilling in box is required but nothing too complicated. Good bass!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler V.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Mitsubishi Montero
customer_reviews.text: Sounds amazing and fits in the OEM tight spot of my Mitsubishi Montero. Bass is accurate which is what I’m after. I don’t care to rattle my neighbors windows. This makes music sound like it was intended. All genres sound good. Rap, Rock, Alternative. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris. B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome replacement Subwoofer for Toyota 4Runner
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement subwoofer for 2003-2009 Toyota 4Runner. The factory subwoofer is a 2ohm sub and the pioneer is a perfect match.
customer_reviews.author: BamaWells

customer_reviews.title: Ram truck with alpine system
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews saying that this subwoofer sounds louder and more clear than the factory sub. So I gave it a shot. After a few months of listening I decided to put my factory subwoofer back In. The pioneer just didn't put out the amount of bass that the factory subwoofer did. I'm not saying that this is a bad subwoofer. But for my application the stock sub seemed better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound and bass improved
customer_reviews.text: Little adjustments had to be made for it to fit my 2011 sonata. Mostly was the wiring which wasn’t supplied typical to other replacement speakers. Sound is way better than factory. More vocals come thru vs factory but the bass is clearly stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Nance

customer_reviews.title: Easy install. Great bang for $$
customer_reviews.text: Definitely better than the factory sub in my 13 Ram. I was expecting a little more but it is definitely better. Gonna get an aftermarket amp next and push it a little harder.
customer_reviews.author: Boostdmopar

customer_reviews.title: Works on my Ram
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my 2015 Ram 2500 Laramie. Sounds better then the stock sub. Direct bolt on, just had to fill the bottom bolt hole with silicone from the stock sub. It’s a bit louder, not much, but hits harder with more base and is much sharper. Sounds great. Would recommend for the price and ease of install.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great in 02 suburban
customer_reviews.text: Like others have reviewed I had to cut some of the metal surround, but it was easy with tin snips. It's not blowing the doors off, but a big upgrade from stock.
customer_reviews.author: Arias

customer_reviews.title: This subwoofer fit perfectly for Toyota Tacoma 2nd Generations 05-15
customer_reviews.text: This subwoofer replace perfectly Toyota Tacoma’s 2nd Generations models with JBL Sound System. I found the original JBL Subwoofer has better deep bass and sound louder for my opinion. But the Pioneers sound quality Is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Flawless Paver & Wash

customer_reviews.title: Toyota 4Runner with JBL Sub
customer_reviews.text: Direct replacement for my 2005 Toyota 4Runner when the factory sub blew out. No new holes needed to be drilled. I just needed to turn the sub a bit and all the holes lined up (see pic). Sound quality is great, but may benefit from some baffling in the stock enclosure.
customer_reviews.author: Joe T

customer_reviews.title: Nice product!
customer_reviews.text: Made of good material quality, this is a very well-made, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: OzzieVald

customer_reviews.title: Quality not so great but definitely better than stock
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed with the quality but does the job. I say it sounds a bit better than the stock speaker but unlike the stock bass when reaching higher volumes this one starts to sound rough, a bit distorted.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Fit my 04 Toyota 4Runner Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: As many others have said, this fits 03-09 Toyota 4Runners with the JBL factory sub. Sounds good, easy to install. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: R. Doug

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade for someone not looking to have a box built
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace the stock Jeep Wrangler jku subwoofer. It fit perfectly and has much better sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Josh L.

customer_reviews.title: Like OEM but better
customer_reviews.text: Work great on my 2003 4runner replacing the rear stock sub woofer
customer_reviews.author: david hedge

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great replacemement for the stock sub in the Jeep wranglers. Much better sound and perfect fit with no mods
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: What I expected
customer_reviews.text: Great value, extremely versatile, and good sound. Just as described so they worked perfectly for the specific application I needed them for.
customer_reviews.author: adrian

customer_reviews.title: Great deal sounds good and fits like a glove in factory spot
customer_reviews.text: Have had this installed in my car for a while now to replace the junk factory sub fit like a glove i even added a inline amp it add some more power sounds great !
customer_reviews.author: Jeef

customer_reviews.title: Drop-in replacement for Wrangler Unlimited- cleaner, tighter bass.
customer_reviews.text: Drop in replacement for the factory sub in a '14 Wrangler Unlimited with the premium Alpine audio system. More efficient, tighter, cleaner bass. Great upgrade and value.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Ozturk

customer_reviews.title: 01 suburban replacement
customer_reviews.text: Replaced factory sub in my 01 suburban had to make a little modification to the stock box but for the price and sound it was worth it
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Solid little subwoofer.
customer_reviews.text: Pioneer has always made a good product and this is no exception I would buy it again. Very good speaker for shallow applications.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bruton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and bass for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for my blown 4Runner speaker. Sounds way better than the factory! This produces great bass without being annoying and over bearing Paid $100 for someone else to install, it was kind of a pain to take the panels off. This is obviously not the speakers fault
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Prefect replacement for blown factory subwoofer!
customer_reviews.text: I used this sub to replace the factory JBL subwoofer in my wife's 2006 4runner. Can honestly say I am very surprised at how well it sounds in the factory enclosure using the factory amp. Would definately recommend using for an application such as the one I used it for. Good bang for the money.
customer_reviews.author: REEDY LONG

customer_reviews.title: Not a waste of money at all!
customer_reviews.text: This is the one! 2001 Chevy Suburban. Quick install and sounds great! Was not listed as a direct replacement bu Pioneer but it works just fine and sounds absolutely great. Deep rich bass. Throughly surprised and very much worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Douglas

customer_reviews.title: ZERO BASS
customer_reviews.text: It works just like other small factory speakers in my 2011 Rubicon but absolutely NO bass from factory radio
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: this FITS perfect in the stock bass box
customer_reviews.text: 2007 FJ Cruiser here, this FITS perfect in the stock bass box. using an small Alpine mono amp to drive it and it sound goood.
customer_reviews.author: AAP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, high quality product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, high quality product at a reasonable price. Timely shipping. Highly recommend product and vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Rand Edelstein

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Used this speaker to replace the stock sub in my 2008 tundra. Easy hooked up and install. Comes with all the hardware you’d need other than extra wire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't find anything wrong with this product other than the price
customer_reviews.text: The song quality is actually better than I thought it would be
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit and great sound up grade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the factory sub in my 2016 dodge ram, perfect fit and great sound up grade, the bass is more crisp and less tin sounding,
customer_reviews.author: ShoppersAnonymous

customer_reviews.title: If you want 4 ohms you connect in series if you want 1 ohm you connect in parallel
customer_reviews.text: Its a good quality sub , depends on how you connect 2 ohm’s or 4 ohm’s its clear sound but not so loud i was installing it on 2014 Lexus ES350 replacing my old one that pop. Its not bad for price and installation wise , very easy to install .
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandr Kleyman

customer_reviews.title: Sub that fits!!
customer_reviews.text: Put this in as a replacement for the factory JBL system sub in my 08 Tundra. Kept the enclosure the same and just wired it up. I was very surprised that the JBL factory amp could run it so well. Obviously a huge improvement over the stock sub. Very happy without spending tons of $$.
customer_reviews.author: C. K.

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for OEM subwoofer in GMC Yukon
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement speaker in my 2002 GMC Yukon XL none bose audio system. I had to make the opening wider on the box to accommodate this speaker. Awesome speaker sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Echo 5 Victor

customer_reviews.title: 2018 Ram 2500 Alpine system OEM swap
customer_reviews.text: Perfect OEM swap, don’t expect a massive upgrade but you can definitely feel it a lot more then stock.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding speaker
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to install and sounds amazing even with stock amp systems.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob T.

customer_reviews.title: Good Subwoofer for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Installation issue was not caused by subwoofer but by difficulty in accessing factory location of blown subwoofer in the SUV. Sound is better than factory subwoofer with no additional power. I expect it would sound even better with a little more push.
customer_reviews.author: C Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Only replace if Factory blown
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not better than stock and i would only buy/use this if my factory sub was blown/broken. Hits lows good not great & thats all it really does. Don’t waste ur money or time unless its blown or got money to waste.
customer_reviews.author: S  Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great OEM replacement for my 4Runner.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement for my factory JBL sub in my 05 4Runner, it’s the only reasonably priced sub thats 2ohm so the factory amp not only drives it without loss in volume it sounds better than flimsy OEM sub.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Fit my 09 jeep factory sub box fine. Screws even lined up
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these. The first from another retailer. Fit my 09 jeep factory sub box fine. Screws even lined up. Powered with a moderate amp. First one went out playing loud. Thought it was a fluke and ordered a replacement. The new one never hit as hard as the first one but sounded ok. finally blew it last night. Once again I was playing it loud.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Drop it, shortie!
customer_reviews.text: Good shallow mount subs are hard to find. This one delivers both value and boom.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: great sub for the price
customer_reviews.text: excellent little sub for the price. I have a custom .37 cu. ft. sealed enclosure and it out performed a $100 shallow mount rockford fosgate sub. It's certainly not going to make the windows rattle but it sounds good for a shallow mount 8" sub.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for OEM subs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great replacement sub for you old OEM subs
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE MELISTAS

customer_reviews.title: Great for my civic
customer_reviews.text: Installed in my 2009 Honda Civic, fits great! Just make sure to add some sound deadning material all around
customer_reviews.author: Youssef

customer_reviews.title: 08 Wrangler
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in a 08 jeep wrangler. It fit perfectly. I had to use the stock subwoofer cover because the one it came with allowed it to vibrate in its enclosure. The stock cover fixed that. I did have to break a small piece of plastic off of the stock cover.
customer_reviews.author: Jacwel57

customer_reviews.title: Good performing, shallow subwoofer at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace my stock vehicle speaker as the vehicle required a shallow sub. I hooked up a modest amp and this thing performs great.
customer_reviews.author: steven johnson

customer_reviews.title: Beats the stock Infinity sub
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the anemic Infinity sub in my 2012 Unlimited Rubicon, install took about 10 minutes. The lows are crisper and have a little more punch. An upgraded amp is in the works, I'll post back when that is it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Mills

customer_reviews.title: Nice subwoofer.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little sub. Fits 05 4runner with the JBL subwoofer in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 2016 RAM 1500 Sport stock sub. Not a huge difference but slightly noticeable improvement,
customer_reviews.author: William D

customer_reviews.title: Good idea to use some sound dampening material such as ...
customer_reviews.text: This sub is a direct replacement for a 2013-2014 wrangler factory sub- holes line up to factory holes and the factory sub grill fits over the new sub. Looks stock when finished. Good idea to use some sound dampening material such as polyfill inside the factory box. Better sound than the cheapy stock.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: This speaker sounds amazing
customer_reviews.text: It took some cutting to replace the factory sub cause the flange that screws to the box was a bit wider. I replaced my wife’s in her suburban and it sounded like a whole new system. Amazing sound quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... have a 5 Channel pioneer amp running it sounds great
customer_reviews.text: Man does this little thing hit I have a 5 Channel pioneer amp running it sounds great
customer_reviews.author: Shaun K

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on my 2002 suburban. I had to trim the metal lip on the speaker to make it fit.
customer_reviews.author: Abelardo L. Carrasco

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer is the best!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Great sound. You can always count on Pioneer. Don’t buy a cheap $20 “Boss” brand subwoofer, I did and sent it back. Then I bought this pioneer subwoofer. Wow! This 8” Pioneer subwoofer sounded so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Roger C.

customer_reviews.title: Good value to add bass
customer_reviews.text: Does what I wanted to do, add some bass to the original factory speakers on my pickup and a very reasonable price. It cannot replace a proper size subwoffer.
customer_reviews.author: mrussell

customer_reviews.title: Dual 2 ohm match perfectly to stock Toyota 4 runner JBL factory subwoofer.
customer_reviews.text: Tired of hearing that blown subwoofer? Looking to replace that factory sub under $100? Look no Further, Good replacement for Toyota 4 runner oem JBL subwoofer. Great build quality, dual 2 ohm subwoofer. Fit factory position 2003-2009 Toyota 4 runner.
customer_reviews.author: Giant Audio

customer_reviews.title: Fits in factory Ford 150 Sony box
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly in my factory sub box, you will need an external amp to power it properly the whimpy factory amp doesn't have the guts to get this subs full potential.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Odgaard

customer_reviews.title: Zero build quality
customer_reviews.text: Lasted two months. One coil went out. When it went silent I didn't even have it that loud. When I took it out of it's enclosure you can smell the burn. I connected to just one coil and works that way, obvious not the way you want to have it connected.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Small but strong.
customer_reviews.text: For a small sub, this thing sounds great. I installed in a custom box to fit a 98 regular cab ford ranger right behind the seat. It takes up very little space and still packs a decent punch. It wont shake windows or rattle your brain loose, bit its good if you want to add that lower end, but dont have much space.
customer_reviews.author: Vanitas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my 2005 Toyota 4 runner plug and play
customer_reviews.author: jheimy flores

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't shake the car but does resonate nicely.
customer_reviews.text: Quite impressed for the size. Made a very small CU box for it that fits under the seat in my accord and it fills in the low notes well. Doesn't shake the car but does resonate nicely.
customer_reviews.author: S. B. Conrad

customer_reviews.title: but an easy install nonetheless
customer_reviews.text: It makes my '02 Suburban bearable to drive now! Not an exact fit, but an easy install nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Had to do just a little bit of adjusting to get it in the rear deck of my 95 Avalon, but once I did...it was on! And it's been on every since. Sounds great and consistent. Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: E. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Speaker sounds good. Not too much bass but enough low end ...
customer_reviews.text: Speaker sounds good. Not too much bass but enough low end is present to let you know there's a subwoofer present. These are supposed to work in free air applications but my speaker sounded terrible until I gave it a small enclosure.
customer_reviews.author: DadOfMax

customer_reviews.title: Insane value!
customer_reviews.text: Huge improvement over Alpine sub in my 18 Ram Truck. Bolts right in with no drilling.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Dunn

customer_reviews.title: I like the little bit I've heard so far...
customer_reviews.text: Still in the process of completing a custom sealed sub box for it. It will be housed on the passenger side under the rear deck of my 2 seater roadster convertible. The 5 channel amp will be under the drivers side of the deck.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L

product_meta.title: Pioneer TS-SW2002D2 8-inch Shallow-Mount Subwoofer with 600 Watts Max Power
product_meta.description:
This 8" shallow subwoofer handles 600W max., 150W nominal power, and delivers deep bass with top-notch sound quality thanks to features like Pioneer(R)'s MICA injection-molded resin which gives it the ability to produce accurate bass.
The TS-SW2002D4 utilizes an oversized cone structure that provides greater cone and gasket surface without changing its standard external dimension. This cone surface allows the subwoofer to produce louder and deeper bass by moving more air. The mounting depth is just 2-5/8" - less than half a typical subwoofer in this class.
feature_bullets: 8" Shallow subwoofer with dual 2-ohm voice coils
Handles up to 150 watts RMS (600 watts peak power)
